Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: catsafrican
Reviews.Content: For the money this was a great place...nice pool...quiet..good area by lots of shops and restaurants..clean...and nice staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but not Chic”
Reviews.Author: DCnative94
Reviews.Content: First, the good part. The staff that I encountered was always nice and helpful. Now the bad part. The hotel looks very dilapidated. In my room, there were stains on the carpet, bedspread and decorative pillows. Pretty creepy. Also, there was a hole in the base of my shower. Its hard to imagine how I didn't flood the room below me when I showered. It was almost impossible to regulate the temp in my room until I figured out how to unlock and open the windows. And the housekeeping crew was erratic. For example, days went by and they did not replenish my toiletries or in room coffee. On my final day I stepped out of the shower to find they had not left me any bath towels!! The breakfast buffet was ok, but the neighborhood is a bit scary. Certainly would not recommend single women walking alone there at night. I know the price was not too high but by way of comparison, I stayed at a lovely Marriott resort in Scottsdale about a year ago for $20 less a night!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: bh_760
Reviews.Content: From San Diego, California. My sisters booked 2 non smoking double queen rooms on Hotels.com for InnPlace Hotel weeks in advance for March 16th-17th, 2012 because we were visiting family to attend a college graduation in the area. InnPlace Hotel told my sisters that one of their rooms was given away at check in, they took no responsibility in their mistake and completely blamed Hotels.com. C'mon! If the hotel is overbooked! It's InnPlace Hotel's fault! They're the one who went to a third party website and said, hey, we have empty rooms, please fill them up at a discount! THEN! OMG! They tried to give my sister a King bed when she booked a room for two queen beds. How was she suppose to fit 4 adults onto 1 king bed! What kind of customer service is that!? then they said all they had was a smoking room. and my sister is a non smoker. OH! and omg, get this, the smoking room the hotel gave my sister the key to, ALREADY had people occupying the room!!! There were people's stuff all over the room! Can you TRUST a hotel who will allow access STRANGERS into your hotel room while you're out and about??? NO! Not only that but they were unapologetic! Then at the pool, unsupervised kids threw a football and hit my nephew in the eye! obviously on purpose because none of them fessed up to it and apologize. there were a lot of kids, looks like they book a lot of student athletes. hot tub was more like a warm tub with jets blowing cold water. plus, there were grown men drinking glass bottled alcoholic beverages, when there were signs posted stating it's not allowed in pool area. Hotel obviously doesn't follow their own rules because the Rude front dest guy saw the idiots drinking around the pool with kids running around barefoot, when he brought a few towels out and didn't say anything! Rude front desk guy with glasses came out to the pool to bring THREE! towels after my sister called from the room to inform the front desk that there were no more towels in the bin, which was clearly opened and you can see that there were no more pool towels! He brought only three towels! when he should have been rolling out a cart full! When I asked him for more towels, he said walking away with his back to me, someone will be out with more towels shortly. After another 30 mins, we just went in without towels. when we got to the front desk, i asked for towels and instead of just giving me some or telling me she will send towels up to the room, the front desk lady said they ran out of towels. then right after she said that, rude front desk guy comes around the corner with three towels and I said, then where did he get those? then she says, that's all they have. lol seriously? if your hotel is all booked, you should be having laundry serviced 24 hrs. Or maybe they didn't run out of towels, they are just prejudice or lazy! I ran into some white guys in the elevator who has been staying there for a week and had the same problem...sure enough I warned them to be careful that the hotel might send people to their room! lol Sure enough there weren't enough towels in the room so I went down the hall to where I saw the maid's cart. I heard maid's in the hotel room and knocked on the door to ask for towels instead of raiding her cart. She came out and asked if that room she was in was my room!? i said no, it's not, that i just want some clean towels. She grabs unfolded towels and proceed to hand them to me! i looked at her and said, oh no, i want CLEAN towels! she said they're clean that she just didn't fold them because she was in a hurry to go home! i guess!!!! when i started walking away, she asked, "do you know if the people in this room left?" i said, NO, i don't know those people! omg what is up with the management in this hotel!? Seriously...this hotel doesn't care about customer service, all they care about is money and they will overbook, double book, whatever just to get your money. Cost more to cancel than it does to actually stay there. There are plenty of other hotels in the same area that look better and have better prices. don't let the pics decieve you. Don't stay at InnPlace Hotel, if you do, it will be the worst experience ever that will ruin your trip and a waste a money. Only good thing was that Hotels.com did refund my sister back for the one room...but then again we booked two rooms...and could not cancel last minute without having to pay a cancellation fee so that my family could stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 55Chuck1956
Reviews.Content: I travel for work frequently and my wife and I travel for pleasure quite often and we will voice our opinions about lousy service or unfriendly employees. We also will compliment facilities about good service and friendly employees. We were both completely satisfied with our 7 day stay at InnPlace Hotel Phoenix North. All of the employees were friendly and helpful, the room was well maintained, the facility was spotless, and the breakfast buffet was superb. We talked about the stay on our way home and neither of us could come up with anything that we didn't like about our stay. Our complments to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Holidays 2011 @ InnPlace Hotel, Phoenix North”
Reviews.Author: Icedhott
Reviews.Content: We booked here through a group arrangement. The price is reasonable for $79 with full breakfast included. The breakfast is worth it for the price...it's comparable with I-Hop quality but because it's a buffet it is much more valuable.The location is very central surrounded by a ring of restaurants and fast foods chain. There is a Metro Center from a stone throw distance from the hotel that has movies theaters, Sears and shopping mall.The Hibachi Grill and sushi buffet next door is really a place you should try after a long hard work out day.The hotel hosted around 128 teens who are competing for the first spot in tennis in the USA four times a year and Phoenix is hosting one event of it. The parents and siblings mostly are there to help coaching and or to relax while one of their kids trying to win. I tried to combine both while managing my son's hectic schedule. The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff is friendly. The gym has barbell, dumbbell, treadmill and a step. The pool and Jacuzzi is nicely kept and a place to relax. Definitely recommend for group stay

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy85365
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overall quiet and comfortable. Large pool, hot jacuzzi, and caring staff. I have more to say about its location, but in a good way. There are dozens of restaurants just a stone's throw away, an amusement park and a large mall within three blocks. I took my family on this business trip and they are just happy to have tagged along. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: lzct
Reviews.Content: The room space is great for a family, 2 queen beds and a pull-out sofa in a separate living area. The linens and technology were great. There were a lot of families so my kids found others to play with. The property is large and it can be a long walk from one location to another so bring a stroller if you have small kids. The hotel is a good value but the meals and poolside snacks can add up. There are lots of good reasonable places to eat within walking distance. The staff were all extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointed with EVERYTHING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ariat167
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we needed to be in this area and with the mixed reviews thought we would give it a chance. I am sitting in the room now trying to figure out how I can get a decent hotel for our last night..... The room is small and older it does seem clean, but shower/tub is small there isn't enough pillows for our family, they have huge pillows on the beds, that obviously do not have cases and I just wonder who touched them last....also the pillows we do use are so old they shrivel up as soon you try to lie your head down. Our toilet was backed up when we arrived, we had to call for a plunger!! The room is so run down the nice front lobby can't conceal the 1 star quality rooms. We awoke to a voice in the hallway system saying to evacuate, that it was a real emergency, evacute. We hurried out- saw NO employees or staff....some other guests said we can go back in, feeling unsure we did but called the front desk they said, oh yeah the elevator caught fire/broke so it triggered the alarm. YET noone called us- talked to us or let us know what was happening. When we rode the elevator yesterday our family got scared like something was wrong it creaked and crunched and thank god we were not on it when it did break!!! 10 mmins after returning to our room 6 fire trucks and an ambulance arrived, then left. I just want out of here. Depending on the trip we stay at Holiday Inn up to Resorts, and this is just not up to any standards we have. I paid $55 a night and I feel like I just threw my money away.

Reviews.Title: “Staff outshines hotel at every turn”
Reviews.Author: jen43
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel needs a bit of updating, but it’s safe, well maintained and clean. I've stayed here 4 weeks over the last two months. The staff is AMAZING. They are kind, personable, accommodating and overall; friendly. It may be in transition, but you wouldn’t know it from the staff. Shelly in reservations is the best I’ve come across in all my business travels. The Front Desk staff is top notch – always helpful. And the staff at the breakfast buffet is so nice. It’s not a 5 star getaway – it’s a second home. That’s the best I could ask for. Thank you all!!

Reviews.Title: “It's leaving Starwood in less than 2 months, but it is a cheap place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Viking94708
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay here in the past 8 years. Of all the Sheraton Four Points in the world, this would rank as the second worst (Chicago Midway is the pits). I knew they were leaving Starwood later this spring and asked them at check-in where they were landing. "Unknown" was their response. Nothing about this place is up to standard. It looks like nothing has been touched in about 10 years. The staff seem a bit slow as well. They don't have express check out's here. The rate was good, $60 on the starwood web site and 2,000 bonus points. For this, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was ok”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Received this property via Hotwire bid. Price was outstanding which probably makes my review a little better than if I had paid regular rate. Room was good size but signs of wear - things that could easily be fixed such as tattered lamp shade, Elevator in need of update - elevator floor just looked dirty. For the rate that I paid, no complaints (definitely much much nicer than anything I would have received at the rate I paid) but hotel is certainly below Sheraton standards. Minimal interaction with staff but overall the 2 staff members that assisted me were efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: CruzNround
Reviews.Content: Things I liked: It's a bit of an older hotel but the room was nice, with a flat screen TV & a decent bathroom. The comforter & pillow coverings were really pretty & luxurious. The pool was beautiful & had a spa, but it was too cold when I was there to use it. The parking was easy, and there was no charge. The location was convenient to the freeway and near a lot of restaurants & a mall. I got to wherever I was going in Phoenix & Tempe within 20 minutes. Things I didn't like: The room was clearly marked No Smoking but it smelled of smoke and there were cigarette burns on the stone counter tops in bathroom. The lock on the window (which I opened to air out the room of the cigarette odor) was broken & a small window lock was added to the track of the window. We were on the ground floor & I am not sure how safe that was. The heat had been turned off and it took a long time for them to get someone in to climb up on a ladder to adjust the HVAC so that it could produce heat, and once that was done, it took forever to heat the room a few degrees.

Reviews.Title: “The room next door was broken into”
Reviews.Author: NewReviews
Reviews.Content: Woke up at 5:20a with people in the room next door screeming (very loudly "Who are you"!!), I jumped up and looked out the peephole to see people running in the hall. Security came up but don't think they even called the police since when I checked out an hour later, no officers had shown up. Went next door to find out the situation and they told me someone had broken into thier room and was crawling on the floor between the beds, getting the wifes earring off the nightstand, the son and husband chased the guy and found the earring in the stairwell. Don't think they ever caught him, lots of questionable looking people hanging out when I checked in...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great value!”
Reviews.Author: sgrace1010
Reviews.Content: After reading negative reviews of this hotel, I decided to visit it in person before making reservations. The hotel staff happily showed me an available room that was floor level with a sliding glass door that led to the outside pool and hot tub. After seeing the room and pool, I was hooked. They had just washed the carpets and were hesitant to let us have the room that night but we assured them that we would be hanging out at the pool for the rest of the afternoon so they let us have the room (room 105, two queen beds). I got an awesome AAA discounted rate by calling and making the room reservation from the hotel lobby. Cost was only $63/night. The pool was cold but it didn't make laying next to it any less enjoyable! The hot tub was awesome and both the pool and hot tub were open until 11pm. There was a also a 24 hour gym that didn't have much in it but enough to get a workout. The breakfast buffet for $8.95/per person was a pretty good deal, especially with the custom made omelets. The beds weren't the most comfortable and one of them creaked every time I turned over. The HVAC unit had a low and a high fan setting and, while it was a little on the loud sound, it worked great for me as I like to sleep with white noise in the background. The hotel is definitely dated but it is well maintained and clean; no musty or old smell like I've experienced in some old hotels. The pool is surrounded by palm trees and is very relaxing. Olive Garden is directly across the street and a short walk brings you to tons of other types of restaurants and stores. It is a great location and a great value! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveler09
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, the room was nice (the quietest hotel room I can ever remember staying in)and clean, the food at the breakfast buffet was very good and overall a very nice stay. My only complaint is that the so-called heated pool was definitely not heated.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: OMAHusker
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a snowstorm in Flagstaff, we ended up needing a room in Phoenix last minute. We picked this one because the last-minute price was right. For the price, I would say this hotel is average at best. Room was outdated, but looked to be clean enough. Beds were comfortable enough. HVAC unit was very loud. At check-in, we asked for a crib for our 2 year old. After a one-hour wait and a reminder call to the front desk, they ended up bringing a crib, but without a sheet or blanket. When I asked the staff person about this, he said they didn't have any more crib bedding. So, I had to strip the sheets off the 2nd bed and use those for the crib. Elevator was extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it.”
Reviews.Author: bigmohank
Reviews.Content: Booked online through the Sheraton.com website, based on experience with other Sheratons - where we were highly pleased. This hotel is old, run-down, and seriously in need of renovation. There was a room service tray on the floor outside the room across the hall when we checked in at 9 p.m. and it was still there at 8 a.m. the next morning when we went to breakfast. The deadbolt knob on the door was almost stripped out of the doorframe - completely loose. There is a single towel rack in the bathroom and sink areas to hang wet towels on. But not next to the sinks, so if you use hand/face towels, you're out of luck The hallways are in need of vacuuming, as are the corners of the room. We thought we got a good deal at $99 a night for a Sheraton, but were sadly disappointed. Checked out one day early and found a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: bigtim116
Reviews.Content: If the conference I was attending wasn't being held in this building or if there was anything else that looked decent in the area I wouldn't have even checked in. Inside and out the building is in poor shape, the front desk was far from welcoming, and my room was gross. If you're looking for a cheap place to crash then sure the place is "good for what you pay" as some others have said, but if you want more than a glorified motel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: jmar907
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in Feb 2011. Rooms are very clean and bright. The breakfast was spectacular....a 15$ value in itself. On our last morning, we were an hour late for breakfast and the chef personally prepared us heaping plates, complete with edible flowers!!! Very impressed, would stay here again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell624
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. You are wasting your money. No hospitality what so ever. Business center sucks. Printer didnt' work but no bother to post a sign. One of the main elevator never worked while our stay of 5 days. Of course there was no information or sign was posted. Hotel smelled so bad. Many room had a problem with A/C. Bed (mine was king) sucks. Pillows sucks. The door doesn't shut tight. You hear everything happening outside. High Speed internet took forever to be connected and froze so often. TV was so old and the back part of it took so much room on the chest drawer. Front staff never smiles at you. Perhaps they don't want to be bothered. Don't ask anything. You will get back lash. There were at least 2 people at the front desk for complaining every morning. For this much money you can find much better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place, motel 6 is better”
Reviews.Author: ronholl626
Reviews.Content: Had to haul stuff up 4 flights of stairs, elevator not close When other rooms close doors, makes loud noise in your room advertised flat screens TV, No flat-screen TV Advertised high speed internet, lasted 10 min then down Complained, Manager stated nothing wrong with internet Manager laughed at me when I explained my dis-satisfaction Left hotel one day early upset at service While close to shops, it has a lot of homeless people, close to transportation hub

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KarenCOttawa
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms very clean and comfortable. The beds were quite comfortable as well. The hotel is older but the staff really keep it up. Nice touch to have complimentary coffee, water, cookies and mini muffins available at the elevator. The one thing we didn't like was the overuse of Febreeze. During our first stay at the beginning of our trip there was no perfume Febreeze smell but the 2nd time we checked in the smell was so overpowering we had to ask for a room change. We asked the staff not to use it during our stay and they honoured our request. The hotel is located in a business area beside a mall and close to I17. It was a perfect spot for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kltrimmier
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great price, was extremely clean and the staff was great. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I have ever slept in at a hotel. Check out Dan the bartender - he's a hoot!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but just a bit noisy in the wee hours.”
Reviews.Author: probity_mom
Reviews.Content: We visited a second time at this Sheraton, the first visit was not wonderful but the location is good for us so we tried again. What a pleasant surprise to see such a nice change in the cleanliness, the service, and even the carpeting! We thouroughly enjoyed our stay! It was wonderful! The staff was very pleasant, the complimentary full hot breakfast was delightful...even an omelet station! I would like to suggest that the staff leave the 15 minute curb for check-in to guests checking in AND that they wait until at least 7am (instead of 5 or 6) to move the patio furniture screeching around on the cement. Otherwise...well done Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: hinta
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews on here we were a little anxious about what we would find. However after a delayed flight in (via Las Vegas airport) due to thunderstorms we arrived at 11.00pm to find no food available but an excellent front desk manager in Bert. Our room was ready and looked great (5th floor) with the wonderful Sheraton bed waiting. Bert sent up complimentary breakfast vouchers for our entire stay as a means of apologising for the lack of the restaurant. Great start. The pool was fine and the buffet breakfasts excellent as was the bar with its resident comedian behind the bar. Vince Vaughan lookalike!!. Location was ideal for the interstate and a couple of restaurants on the Metro Park within walking distance. (Chilis and Olive Garden). All in all a good choice at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: DJELP
Reviews.Content: This is a great place if you want to go to the mall or a nearby eatry. The walls are paper thin I could hear the guy next room taking a p---, at about 2am. TVs could use replacing with the newer HDs, counter was great.

Reviews.Title: “Review your stayfolio they charge you for nothing and do nothing about it!”
Reviews.Author: santanman
Reviews.Content: This is a 1980 property when it was The Westcourt.Metrocenter is a crime ridden rundown ghetto area in the present day.I would not refer anybody to stay here.Let alone if you dont watch your bill they will charge you to see if you notice.Then do nothing for you after the charge.My exp with the mgmt of this property has been a joke.

Reviews.Title: “I will DEFINITELY be back”
Reviews.Author: ImurDaddysGirl
Reviews.Content: We were recently traveling for several weeks with my husband and step daughter and stopped to visit our family who lives in Phoenix for a few days. We had originally booked 2 nights at the Millennium Resort in Scottsdale (review also posted). At the urging of our family we decided to extend our stay one more night but knew we were NOT going to do so at the Millennium. We then booked a room here. Let me tell you. If you are looking for an opulent place you basically never have to leave and focus your entire vacation around the resort... then this isnt the place for you. But if you want an amazing room with great service and an outstanding price, this is most DEFINITELY the place. We were so impressed that we even extended our stay further and stayed almost an entire week there! The front desk staff was amazing and incredibly accommodating, the rooms were clean (although carpeting could use a bit of updating) and beds very comfortable. My only complaint would be with the hot tub. It did not seem to be filled enough or by the time we got to it (we went down approximately 10 pm) the water had went down to where the jets splashed water in your face or above the waterline. Also there was a slight mildew smell to the hot tub area. Even with those "issues".... I would rather stay at this hotel rather than paying 3 times the price, the resort fees, and dealing with the typical "Snobsdale" attitude of the Millennium ANY DAY! Way to go Sheraton... We are in Phoenix about once a month so you will be seeing ALOT more of us!

Reviews.Title: “Don't give up your credit card information to soon!!”
Reviews.Author: coooltravelmom
Reviews.Content: Well, my husband and I had plain for this trip the first of this year 2010. And we wanted a nice hotel in a great locations because we were planning to buy a home in AZ. So my husband choice was the Four Points Sheraton. It was very nice had everything you wanted in a hotel. The Wi-Fi was not that great kept loosing a signal, very weak. The bed was so comfortable. Everything was nice we wanted to come back to close on our new home. But when we arrived back to Chicago and my husband opened his mail and he received a bill from his credit card company for the amount of $346.00. Well you see, the hotel needed his credit card number just in case we used any items like the telephone (which we did not use, we have our own) , or the microwave, that never came to the room. So my husband call them to find out what were the charges and they kept transferring him to different departments. He never got a chances to talk to anyone. So he called his credit card company and told them to cancel that charge because he did not use anything from the Sheraton Four Points. We paid cash for our trip thru our travel agent. So we could not understand what the charges were for?

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were looking for a cheap weekend getaway, and just booked on hotels.com. The location isn't a very good one. Yea it's near the metro center, but I feel like this hotel is located in the ghetto, and I found myself always double checking to make sure my car was locked so nothing would get stolen out of it. The lobby and other shared areas of the hotel are all very nice. They have nice seating with a flat screen TV in the lobby which is nice, and everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel was very nice and the front desk manager who checked us in was very polite and guest service oriented. The room was nothing special, the bathroom had a door that was "spring loaded" and closed on its own, which was kind of annoying because you would leave it open then in about 30 seconds you would hear a bump and I could never figure out what it was until I realized it was the door. The air conditioning worked but it had to be set to about 50 degrees to get the room cool in the intense Phoenix summer heat. And the TV is at an awful position, it can swivel around but it is still a bad position. Free wi-fi which works, always a plus. The beds are not comfortable at all. I had a very hard time falling asleep, and woke up very early because they were so uncomfortable. We used the pool at night which was good because there wasn't many people in there. The pool was big which was nice, but it was very dirty, to the point of people were coming and leaving because they took one look and were disgusted. Overall, there was good service and the rooms were decent, pretty much you get what you pay for. It was a place to stay on our weekend getaway, but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: ricardomt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good, rooms are clean and spacious, but the location is not the best. The Metrocenter area and the Mall itself do not look like very safe places to walk alone. Breakfast and restaurant are okay, nothing special about them. Pool is very good and surrounding area offers good dining options in terms of chain restaurants. For shopping, I'd recommend driving to Arrowhead or Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: LovestoteachIowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year. But after reading some of the recent reviews on this hotel, we decided not to stay here the first night. We decided to drive to Phoenix and check out this hotel and then decide on our stay for the next two nights. Rooms looked very nice just like last year. The area did not look unsafe, and we even shopped late at the Metro Mall just a short drive down the road. Check in was great. The staff members were all very friendlly. Nice computer area to check emails, etc. Comfortable beds and we got the best night's sleep at this hotel. Give me a Sheraton any day!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: blueloozer
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay we were supposed to get a cabana room. I had contacted the hotel months prior to book this specific room type. Upon arrival, the desk clerk said he didn’t have one available. He would not look at our confirmation number and information because he said it wouldn’t do any good. We had to take a regular room. The following day we discussed this issue again with the front desk. We discovered there was a room available but it needed to be cleaned! She said it would be ready in 10 or 15 min. We waited two hours to move and did not get an offer of assistance. Also, this hotel states, they have a Bar and Grill that is open from 6:30am to 10:00pm. This is not true. You receive little more than a continental breakfast in the morning. Most hotels include this in your stay. Four Points serves the same thing every morning for a charge. THE RESTURANT (if that’s what you want to call it) CLOSES AROUND 10:30AM AND OPENS AGAIN FOR DINNER. The dinner buffet is just as minimal as breakfast. The room service information doses you no good, because they are not open to accommodate. HOUSEKEEPING is another story. On the second day we came back to our room to find the used wet towel from showering earlier, wadded up under the clean folded towels on the rack, therefore the new towels were now damp. Also, the bed was half made. They pulled up the covers and bedspread, but left all the pillows thrown about the room. The other couple we traveled with had issues with there television and WI-FI. I will never stay at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “complete let down”
Reviews.Author: littlesarcasm
Reviews.Content: This is a Sheraton??? The rooms were dated and the hotel smelled musty. The room was small with a strange set-up: Seemed like a quick fix idea to get a king bed in the room and use the closet door to also serve as the partition for the bathroom??? The pool area was poorly maintained and does not look anything like the pics posted on their site. Service to the rooms was not until late in the day - after 3pm WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN OR RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total and utter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sonny0107chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Traveled with clients and customers and to say it in one word "embarassed". The hotel was extremely out dated, dirty and the staff there does not know how to do there Job. The bar would claose at diffrent times of the day so that no one would know when it was open or closed. The carpet is on the last threads. The cleaning crew would take up to 5pm before the re-did rooms. You would never leave the hotel after dark because of the neighborhood. I can go on but am trying to forget this whole expierience. PLEASE PLEASE listen to me and DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value priced just a bit of a musty smell”
Reviews.Author: eruditetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. Is in a safe area with multiple chain restaurants in a loop around the hotel. The building is clean and has friendly staff. The room was clean but did seem old with a sort of dingy stale odor to our room that improved slightly by turning on the air. The windows are sealed shut so we couldn’t let air in. We had a king room that was fairly spacious. Traveled to Phoenix again a week later and decided not to stay at this hotel mainly because of the stale odor although at $80 per night it was a pretty good deal. If you are looking for a safe place that has clean rooms in this price range then you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at yet”
Reviews.Author: Adventureman29
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff are friendly and courteous, Our room was cleaned every morning. Free buffet breakfast. Use of pool, hottub, exercise room and internet room was added bonuses. Close to Metrocentre and Castle and Coasters. Would definitely stay here again! - A- Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “More for young families, not for couples”
Reviews.Author: mzglorybe
Reviews.Content: They host a lot of sports teams here, Kids going in and out of rooms with heavy doors that slam hard, talking in groups at the elevator. Our room was adjacent to elevator. The door slamming was the worst, until about midnight. The room was adequate, bedding nice, but a bit crowded walking around the bed. The old TV in our room would go off when you opened and closed a clothing drawer beneath it. At over $100 a night, we will stay elsewhere next time. No microwave, mouthwash or shower caps but they do have a small fridge and free bottle of water. The $8.95 buffet breakfast is not included, although we noticed that some people had coupons, we were not offered any. We paid for the buffet once, as it was the only choice as opposed to leaving the hotel, and it was cold and slim pickin's as we got in at 9:30 a.m. just before closing. The location is good however, close to major restaurants and freeway, but there are several other places to stay for less that include a light breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Barb826
Reviews.Content: If you can get a room for less than $100 a night, then I'd recommend it! The staff is very friendly, nice and helpful. My room was clean and rather large. The other reviews are right...they must have renovated the rooms (mine was just fine), but the hallways, lobby, restaurant and outside need to be renovated!! The WiFi worked fine for me with the execption of once during a 3 night stay and they were working on it when I called the front desk. It didn't take long for it to be up and running. I had a little trouble getting the temp in my room at a comfortable level, but it wasn't awful. My room wasn't stinky. I was given coupons for the free breakfast buffet. I went once during my 3 night stay and for FREE, I was happy to have something. They did have a good variety for those of us who choose to grab and go! This was also the first time I ever did laundry at a hotel. BUT...they did have washers and dryers and since I'm on a 3 week business trip...I was glad to have had the opportunity to do a load of laundry. I was pleased to have a large room that was CLEAN and comfortable! I feel confident with recommending this hotel if you aren't expecting the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: dtc05
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasted a major renovation. There was evidence of rust around the elevators off the lobby, which also worked very poorly. They also get you for local phone calls, which we did not know until check out since it was not indicated anywhere, at .75 a pop. The weight room also was in poor condition. Our television had lines running across the top, which I felt was pretty sad. I would not recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing special and screwed up the billing”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week during a conference held at the hotel. Pros - Staff were generally friendly and accomodating, the rooms were comfortable and clean, the pool was nice after a long day, free internet Cons - The food in the restaurant was not very good (bland and too salty), the workout room only has broken, barely-functioning equipment, and the surrounding area doesn't offer much to do after a long day. They also screwed up the billing, and it took a month to sort out. I don't think I'd stay here again. I'd find a hotel closer to more interesting attractions, then drive to the conference. I think it'd be ok for a quick overnight trip, but a week was far too long to spend near the metrocenter mall.

Reviews.Title: “A huge let down!”
Reviews.Author: flagsup
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old, dated and dirty!!! The service was poor and slow. A breakfast plate sat outside a room for 2 1/2 days until I requested that someone clear it away. The shower was clogged and overheard others complain about the same. The bar was pleasant and the food wasn't bad. Dinning the last evening of our stay was the worst. The watress came out once to take our order (a group of 10 softball players and wives) she never came back to refill our drinks - we needed to get them ourselves at the bar. The food came out over an hour later and it was cold and not very good. We all compalined about the poor service that evening. The hotel computer was not working so we did not get our wake up calls (twice) we also were awakened at 10pm - we had an early game time with a request from the front desk to update our credit card info as it was lost! The pictures on the web site do not represent this hotel! Lots of apologies when complaints were brought to the attention of the front desk but this hotel needs alot of tender love and care and a bit more attention to the guests comfort and needs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: swampfoxcws
Reviews.Content: We were traveling Colorado to San Diego, and had stayed here before. We were very pleased with the rate, about $60 for a king room, and a free full breakfast with our AAA card. I suppose that summer is the off season, but we were very satisfied with every aspect of the stay.....pleasant and helpful staff, very clean facilities, nice pool and hot tub, quiet, clean, comfortable room, wireless internet with good connection, very good breakfast and great coffee, plentiful ice water in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelGurl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was last minute after our plans to the Grand Canyon had to be cancelled due to travel delays. The hotel was very clean and full of useful traveller amenities -- pool, large screen TV, free internet access, etc. As a Starwood Preferred Gold member, we were given a room on the Preferred Guest Floor and the front desk person (not sure if he was mgmt) gave us coupons for two complimentary breakfast in their restaurant -- excellent. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time here”
Reviews.Author: nilsSt_paul
Reviews.Content: trust me when i say you will not regret shelling out a hundred some bucks to stay at four points. the place was great and affordable, the rooms are clean and comfortable, highly recommend. only down side is the hot tub could be re done it was small and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Vol_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel. I am not a regular Four Points customer, so I was not sure what to expect. This hotel is ok. There was nothing outstanding about the apperance of the hotel. The room was clean and fairly safe. It's extemely close to ASU and easy to access from the interstate, lots of places to eat nearby. The bed was extremely comfortable, flat panel tv. I found the internet connection to be extremely slow. The parking lot was a little scary...dark on one side. I would stay here again, but I would not go out of my way.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: pensacola60641
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great for the price. Lots of restaurants around. Mimi's our favorite for breakfast. Location of hotel is great. Staff was very nice. Room could use a bit of updating but not bad - I would definately staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: weeniedog2000
Reviews.Content: The staff here is terrific! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. All hotels should follow their example. We stayed here for three nights, and chose the hotel based on its location (just off I-17). Although the hotel is not brand new, every area, including our room was clean and well-kept. The beds were large and comfortable, and we had a pool side room on the first floor. The location of the hotel, near Metro Center shopping mall, offers up a lot of shopping and dining options. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, and the buffet offered many selections. We spent an hour in the bar one evening, and our bartender was friendly and entertaining. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, reasonable place to stay, and would be good for anyone traveling on business or for pleasure. The pool makes it nice if you're traveling with your kids, and there is an amusement park for them called Castles and Coasters in the Metro Center complex.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest staff anywhere”
Reviews.Author: sadiepup89
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here by accident in May, '08--the Sheraton across the street was full. What we found was the most attentive and gracious staff of any hotel we've ever stayed at. Now when we have to go to Phoenix we always stay here. Everyone--from Sam behind the desk, to Amparo in Housekeeping to Jose on the grounds to Carol in the gift shop and Sandy and Andy in the restaurant, treats us like family. The attached restaurant --Copper Creek--is a true find--with a fantastic hot breakfast that is free if you're a Starwoods member but still a great value if not. It's also open for lunch and dinner, and the food is simply delicious and reasonable too--also never busy. Last time we were here in August, they let us sit outside by ourselves and turned the mister on just for us. We like to get a room on the ground floor facing the pool. The grounds and the flowers are beautiful. Rooms are nice with those great Sheraton beds and plenty of pillows. When we stayed a week ago, we got a special $60 deal, but even normally the prices are very reasonable. The pool is big enough and always clean, the jacuzzi always works, the work-out room has a TV and when there's any kind of problem, the staff comes running. We love it so much, we're thinking of spending our 15th anniversary here instead of some overpriced "resort" that turns out to be disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “There Aren't That Many Starwood Dumps Around, But This Is One”
Reviews.Author: Flyintl
Reviews.Content: This Four Points property is a dump. It's old, the "non smoking" rooms smell like smoke (or it could be mildew). I checked in at 9pm and asked for a non-connecting room and when I opened my door, it was a connecting room. At 9pm on a Monday night, the bar was closed, the restaurant was closed and the little store was closed, so if you want anything to eat/drink, you need to leave the hotel. Oh yeah, the front desk guy told me there are vending machines next to the ice machines (I checked two floors and there are NO vending machines next to the ice machines.) The hallways are dingy and smell of mildew. The carpet is, well, let's just say that you should keep your shoes on. The shower is in a half-tub. I've never seen one before, but it's literally a half a tub. There is FREE water in your room...one bottle that is. And, as a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold member, you get "upgraded' to a dumpy room on the ground floor facing the parking lot (room #150). There are no SPG perks at this hotel, so stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel in a hot city”
Reviews.Author: Nolita
Reviews.Content: Our traveling party only stayed one night in this chain hotel located in Phoenix across the street (within walking distance) from alarge shopping area full of eateries, a Barnes & Noble and even a grocery store. The staff were friendly, helpful. They provide 2 free internet access computers in the lobby with free printing. The buffet breakfast (included) provided a wide selection including make-it-yourself waffles. Fresh fruit, egss, meat, yopgurts and cereals/breads. Lots of light. Clean. Rooms included ipod ports. Separate toilet from sink area allowing more than 1 person to get ready in the morning. Enough room to walk around. I would recommend this hotel which is fairly close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Palce”
Reviews.Author: Antunez
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Phoenix on business for 8 days and chose the Sheraton Four Points Metro Center. It is surrounded by many restaurants (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Chili's, El Torrito) and next to the Metro Center mall. The location is great for a business travel, because when you get back to the hotel, you don't have to drive far to get dinner. The room I stayed in (#148) was nice. A little older, but quiet and comfortable. It had BLAZING wireless internet, that never failed and connected instantly. A big plus for business. There was a small fridge and coffee in the room. I liked the to-go cups for the coffee and used them as I rushed out the door to my appointments. I stored all my water bottles and leftovers in the fridge, so it was very much appreciated. There is a restaurant and bar / lounge on the premises. I ate dessert (pecan pie that was to die for!) and had drinks there. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. It seemed everyone I spoke with there, was really enjoying their stay. One great amenity that I wasn't expecting was poolside food and drink service. After 5pm you can order food and drinks from the pool area (burger and a beer!) and charge it to your room. Such a great plus if you're weary from your day and just want to relax and not have to go anywhere. I had a chance to speak with one of the owners of the hotel who seemed very interested in the guest's viewpoint. He mentioned that they would be renovating the rooms and some of the common areas before the busy fall / winter season. All in all, I really like the hotel and would gladly recommend it to others. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marci_M
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is a nice upscale hotel at a very reasonable price. Rooms are clean and bright and the walls are acceptably thick; I could hear my neighbors but only during one of their several climaxes. Most of the hotels are on the dingier westside of town, but don't let that stop you---it's not a bad neighborhood, and there are several national restaurant chains closeby, but the trendy part of town is a few miles away. No free breakfast, but for $8.95 there's an all you can eat breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Clean, Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: lulumoomoo
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting anything great from this hotel, but boy was I pleasantly surprised! The room was really large, extremely clean, and very comfortable. Everything was very cute (pillows labeled with soft, firm, cute amenities in the bathroom, etc) and just so nice! I wasn't expecting to love it so much. The hotel isn't in the most exciting area, but I was looking for somewhere to stay and didn't mind driving to places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: triptraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our fifth in 5 nights. It was very nice, tied for the nicest. It was just what one would expect from Sheraton. The bedding was fresh & clean and the bed had lots of pillows. The room was quite large. The toilet and shower/tub (a square shape with a seat ) was separate from the sink/closet/coffee station. The closet door, when opened, also worked as a door to the sink area which was great for me with two kids of the opposite sex. Everyone had a place to change in private. Our room was quite the walk from the lobby but we found another entrance and nearby elevator to make things easier. There is an Olive Garden directly across the street and we could see a Chili's is under construction outside our window. A mall and an amusement park are close by. The highway (I-17) is within a 1/2 mile. The pool and spa area was very nice. The pool had lots of floats to amuse my son. I used 4000 of my SPG points for the night. A Friday or Saturday would have only been 3000. As far as hotel points go that is a bargain, especially for such a nice room. The hotel is 17 miles from the airport and they do not offer a shuttle. I'd certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Australianchick
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! Very impressed. The hotel was modern, the rooms and bathroom were clean, and the beds had lovely bedding on them. It had all the amenities including an empty fridge which was great for storing some snacks in. We loved the coffee machine too. The pool looked very inviting even though it was a little too cold for us! The location was great... not in the downtown area (obviously) but in amongst several shopping centres within walking distance. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: RogerVegas
Reviews.Content: This stay at the Four Points was great! Check in was fast and easy. The staff was pleasent and explained the hours of the resteraunt, the free use of the computer to check in for flight, the pool, etc. The room was clean and a nice size. I had a room overlooking the pool on the third floor. The room comes with in room coffee maker, bottled water at no charge. The hotel is about 20 minutes from where we were going out for the evenings and is near a mall. We did not eat at the mall or off property resteraunts. Had breakfast at the hotel, very simple buffett and not the best but not the worst I have had. There is a Denny's right down the road which would be less expensive. We ate there each of the three mornings for the convience of it all. The bar is small but nice. The bartender was very friendly and they even had a happy hour with $3 drinks! The maid service was good, the room was always spotless and clean. The pool is simple and has a spa. Overall I would stay here on my next visit to Phoenix. The price is great, good staff and easy to get where you need to go. Only drawback it is about 30-45min from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NevadaSteven
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Phoenix for a vacation weekend and I've stayed at other Four Points in LA so I thought this would be a good mid range place to stay. The location around the Metro Center mall in the northern part of town is very good. It's easy on/off the freeway and about 1/2 hour to either downtown or Scottsdale. There are plenty of chain restaurants like Red Lobster, Olive Garden, etc. for decent dinners, and shopping for those who are into that. I found the hotel was not up to the level of the two Four Points I've stayed in elsewhere. The room looked "tired" and the bathroom was smaller than their other locations.By the way, I'm a Starwood Gold member, so I assume my room was one of the better ones. Our price included full buffet breakfast, and I have to say it was one of the worst I've had anywhere. The first day they ran out of coffee before we arrived in the restaurant and it only was replenished after I had eaten. The cereal (raisin bran) was definitely generic, and also stale. There was only whole milk (so much for healthy eating), and the bread and pastries were pretty awful as well. Fruit was your typical cut cantaloupe and honeydew, both of which were tasteless. There were supposed to be vending machines on each floor, but the one on my floor was missing, and my search only turned up a soda machine on the floor below. I was scheduled to stay at another Four Points in another city this week, and when I got home I canceled and booked a different chain. Two days at this one was quite enough for one month.

Reviews.Title: “Much better then last visit”
Reviews.Author: FunTrvlCpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago while it was under remodeling, now it's much better. Room was clean and bed was comfy. They have one of the best fitness rooms that we have ever seen in a hotel this size, very new equipment and free weights. We ordered room service many times and they did a great job and the food was yummy! Did the breakfast buffet on Sunday morning and it was a mess, must have been short staffed. They comped us a free breakfast for the trouble and that was fair. Free internet and a comp/printer in the lobby..nice! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeni_travels
Reviews.Content: We got a king non-smoking room with a AAA rate of $89/night and stayed for 3 nights. Upon our arrival, we were greated by very friendly staff. They let us check in 3 hours early and upgraded us to a garden view room for free. The outside garden area was beautifully maintained and decorated with lights for the holiday season. Though we didn't take advantage of the pool, I scoped it out. It appeared heated and had food/drink service available. The hotel was in a convenient location within walking distance to restaurants and close to I17 for easy travel. The staff was awesome. Our room was very clean and they gave us plenty of the amenities offered (coffee, creamer, etc). Good quality stuff too. No complaints at all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FREQUENT-FLYAH
Reviews.Content: Nice, reasonably priced hotel.. staff was very polite and super helpful. Every week the hotel has a specially themed poolside party, serving food, drinks, and showing movies. Had a very relaxing time at the Metrocenter. However, be prepared to pay about $40 for the super lloonnnggg cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprize for the price!”
Reviews.Author: zina
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel fairly close to The Glendale arena to attend a concert. But, we also wanted to be able to enjoy a resort type setting with a great pool and nice rrom at a very affordable rate. We got just what we asked for. I used the hotel website and got a $65 summer rate with 2 double beds. We were upgraded upon arrival (ask and you shall receieve) to a ground floor room with a walk out to the pool view. It was very convenient and what a view. The room was very nice and seemed to be updated nicely. The bathroom was exceptionally large with a large sink area seperate from a vanity area and an interesting but nice shower/tub combo. Lots of water pressure and heat from the bath. There was a pocket door in the toilet shower area and a swivel type shuuter style door that closed off the bath from the bedroom area if you wanted too. I liked that since I had an 8 year old son with me. As a Starwood Preferred Guest, along with my email confirmation, I was sent a B1,G1,Free breakfast buffet coupon which was really nice and above average. Lots of fresh food to choose from. Can't say enough about the pool. Maybe I just needed the break, but it was large, clean and sparsely occupied. There were lots of pool toys, floats, noodles and the like provided by Four Points. Lastly, staff was very friendly and accomodating. We were able to recieve a later check out so that we could enjoy the pool just a bit longer. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good jumping off point”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: Okay hotel. Near mall and other stores, but not near downtown or Scottsdale. Our room was nice as the bed was comfortable and spacious. The problem with the hotel is more on the inside. The hallway was a bit dated and had a musty smell. There was also a McDonald's bag on the floor the evening we checked in and it was still there the morning we checked out. The buffet was good, but there were no pancakes and waffles available. The pool looked nice. We did not use it however. All in all, it is a good hotel, with some shortcomings. We used it as a jumping off point after landing in Phoenix and heading to points north.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Samihaha
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels for the price. At $69 a night over the memorial day weekend, this hotel is a great deal. My gf and I stayed at a regular room with a King size bed. There was a small refrigerator where we stocked our bottled water for the hot summer weather in Phoenix. There was a large CRT TV (probably about 27"). The mattress had a padded top so it was very soft and comfortable. The bathroom had a shower and a small tub. It wasn't not a jacuzzi tub so no jet streams. I imagine for a jacuzzi tub, guests would have to shell out extra for a suites. Worry not, there's a public jacuzzi right by the public swimming pool. The swimming pool was big with heated and salted water (not chlorinated). A couple of days before my arrival at the hotel, the hotel sent out an email to give me a coupon for 1-for-2 breakfast. Otherwise, the breakfast costs $8.95 per person. Breakfast buffet was consisted of standard fares of scrambled eggs, French toast, sausage, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, bread and bagel, and some other stuff. Nothing fancy. A la carte is also available at additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Four Points Metrocenter is a perfect place to stay on business. It has a nice restaurant (I ate there for breakfast and dinner), pool, outdoor jacuzzi, FREE wireless Internet access, Wednesday evening reception for corporate guests, and the rooms are modern and cheerful. The staff is definitely friendly and are very cheerful with guests. I definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Scratch”
Reviews.Author: Rileyke
Reviews.Content: Let’s face it this hotel has problems. The room I had was not that great for a deluxe room. The bathroom was small with no tubs and just a shower. The air conditioning unit was very noisy. The carpet was not clean. There was a mini refrigerator out in the open of the room. The overall appearance of the lobby and elevators is tacky. The pool is not inviting. The gym was not good due to equipment not being maintained properly. The staff were somewhat friendly and do try to provide some customer service. Overall, I would not stay at this Four Points Hotel again. My experience and impression of the Hotel was one of a rundown Hotel on the verger of trying to meet the Starwood/Sheraton standards. The Hotel falls short.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: The-Motel-Mavens
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. The remodeling is completed, so previous reviews about older furnishings and debris are no longer applicable. Everything has been attractively redone except for the shower stalls (if you're looking for a soaking tub, this isn't the place.) At the AAA rate of $59 (summer season) the Sheraton Four Points is a bargain. The king beds are extremely comfortable, with feather sleeping pillows and large feather throw pillows for resting in bed or watching TV. The TVs are large, with Showtime and around 23 channels -- adequate. The rooms have a desk and an easy chair, decent lighting, granite counter in the bathroom, fluffy towels, and individually-controlled air. The staff is very helpful. The first time we stayed, as Starwod Preferred Guests, we were given a free upgrade. The second time we stayed the hotel was rather full and there were a few people smoking on our nonsmoking floor, giving the hall a bit of a smoky odor. We got a towel from the front desk to put under the door. Overall, for the comfort and the price, this hotel can't be beat. We have become loyal customers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Points Phx Metrocenter”
Reviews.Author: LondonEnglandLaura
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and enjoyed it very much. The room was comfortable, the area was quiet (despite being so close to the freeway), & the staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant was excellent and good value for money, with no waiting! Metrocenter has lots of nice restaurants to choose from, but my friends and I were very happy to eat at the restaurant because the food was just as good and the same price as the external restaurants - and there was no waiting! Dan, the bartender, was good fun and very entertaining. The pool area was a great spot for relaxing and chatting. I loved the fact that I could walk to the shopping mall and some other big local stores, and the library next door would be a great place to take bored children as they had lots of things to do to keep kids occupied. I will definitely stay there again and would happily recommend it to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I thought Oh my God where am I going to be staying, but to my surprise the hotel is really clean. Everything smells well, breakfast is great, the hotel room and bed is very comfortable with a huge tv and you can hardly hear the neighbours. Fantastic, Victor

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: 65Becky
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at the Four Points Sheraton. It was a very nice hotel to stay at. It is right in the middle of a shopping complex. There are numerous resturants around and the Metro Center mall is right up the parking lot. The pool was great it was never crowded. The rooms were all redone. Big beds with great duvet covers and fluffy feather pillows. The bathroom was nice but the tub was very small. It was like a shower only. We had a smoking room the view was of a parking lot, but we think all hotels give the smokers the not too good rooms. All in all the stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting from Four Points”
Reviews.Author: Covington_girl
Reviews.Content: The room was large, but not as nice as I expected. The view behind my room was consturction of some kind. The tub was tiny. They had to reset the wireless router several times so I could use the wireless network. They sent the mechanical engineer to my room when I asked for assistance with the network. He was nice but not helpful. I was told by several not to park on the side of the hotel and not to leave after dark because it was not a safe area. Because I was a person traveling alone, I was a little scared. It put a damper on my stay. Breakfast was a nightmare. If you stay here, go with plenty of time to spare. All four days when I went to the breakfast buffet (7:30 - 8:00 am), I had to wait for a table and wait for the food to be replaced.. Now for something nice. The pool and hot tub were great. Housekeeping did a good job. I wish I had checked the reviews here first!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: corinski
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of April. All in all it was a very pleasant stay. Let me tell you all the PRO's first. Some good things about the hotel is that the staff is very friendly and will go out of your way to please you. We went down to the hotel resturant about 10 mins after they stopped serving breakfast, but they still served us breakfast upon our request. The hotel gives you free drink and breakfast buffett coupons to use in their resturant. The buffett was actually pretty good and had a large variety of foods, such as eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, many juices, waffles, milk, yogurt, oatmeal, ect. And it was very tasty. Although we did not use the pool, it was a very nice looking pool and always seem to have people in it enjoying it. Another plus of this hotel? We stayed in the King Bed room and it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. My boyfriend agreed! The housekeeping was great, always did a really good job at cleaning up and providing fresh towels, etc. Now for the cons: the hotel is old and I am sure that 30 years ago, this was the place to stay. The hotel does need some updating but all in all it is keep decently clean. Another downside is that the hotel does not keep up with picking up the dishes outside of hotel doors, when we would come back to the hotel room at night we would walk down the hallway and it was littered with plates, and dishes. A definate eyesore. Also, the shower was a little old and had some strange peeling on the sides of it that would rub off on your feet when you were in there. Kind of gross. Other than the decor eyesore, this hotel was a decent place to stay for what the cost was. For those of you out of town and not familar with the hotel location, it is right next to a mall called Metrocenter and is within walking distance to several resturants!

Reviews.Title: “at first I thought it was Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Seachild
Reviews.Content: on checking in we were allocated a king room for 4 adults despite booking a double double room. hotel was full so had to make do for one night! too tired to care. Breakfast was a disaster zone, I understand the hotel was full but no clean tables, nobody organising guests, food depleted, no menus ofered, cold coffee, no milk on tables etc etc after a full dy out and requiring a quick change for dinner we were told our new room was not ready nor were any other rooms, we had to use the old room to shower, run down corridors with wet hair, half unpacked bags to get dressed for our dinner date. all in all a very negative experience. The breakfast the next day was marginally better but what hotel/restaurant or even B&B has crushed table cloths on the table ? Picky ? well just very basic standards. The rooms were good, good size, good facilites, great shower although I agree some of the refurb was dodgy- half painted bathroom door ??? The hotel ground floor looks refurbished and the general areas too but had a sad feeling of no atmospehere overall. not sure why, a feeling of uncared for neglect ? didn't have any other food as found Mimi's across the lot and Starbucks inside Barnes and Noble. the hotel served a purpose for us as we were visiting family nearby and as it was Spring Training our options were limited. just surprised the Sheraton name was over the door, felt more like a Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Hotel so-so, steadily improving under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Azilla
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton Phoenix Metrocenter really needed professional attention sooner, but the patient shows promising signs of recovery. I stayed here as part of a group trip, assigned to the hotel by chance, not choice. After reading reviews here on TripAdvisor, my concern levels elevated, but it proved a pleasant stay. First impressions from the lot and outside help the hotel. The hotel keeps the lot clean, the landscaping looks nice, and the outside of the hotel looks clean. The parking lots provide ample space and the decent lighting helps you feel safer walking up to the lobby. The hotel sits within the Metrocenter shopping area--good chain restaurants such as Olive Garden and Bennigan's abound within easy walking distance, as does shopping obviously. The lobby and registration desk dress to impress--soaring open space with plant draped peek-throughs from upper floors, a large sunken pit area with lots of nice comfortable heavy leather furniture and tables, a raised area with large bookshelf spaces, tables with nice chairs, and some other furniture in small groups. Look closer, though, and you see a few problems. Two bench style seats along the railing surrounding the sunken pit area looked quite sorry--one showed multiple pulls in the fabric and both carried the crud of many years' use--large darkish areas on the arms and seats, nicks in the wood finish. They should hide these two seat benches from guests' view for now until they refurbish them. In the raised area with the bookcases, you see that the books remain only for show--mostly multivolume sets of huge outdated legal code books, with just a few novels tucked in several hundred pounds of books. Two cream-colored upholstered armchairs in the corner near the walkway to the restaurant really detracted from this area, too. They showed the grunge of several years of use, too--I wouldn't sit in one in all honesty. These two chairs should disappear from guests' view, too, until more presentable. The carpet shows a few dark stains here and there, too. The courtyard looks really nice--healthy trees illuminated at night by mini white light wrapped trunks, tile walkways--very pleasant. The pool and hot tub looked very clean. I did not partake, but I saw others enjoying these facilities. The staff at the desk proved very nice and knowledgeable. They must be under some stress with the corporate Sheraton folks constantly in and out during the refurbishment. We saw the desk staff talking with departing corporate personnel late one night while we loitered in the lobby. Maybe the staff are more relieved to finally see renovations under way, then they are stressed to have corporate in and out all of the time : ) The gift shop off the lobby proved a pleasant surprise. Tidy, neat and clean, with a nice selection of, I can't hardly believe it, reasonably priced almost to the point of saying bargain priced items. $3 dolphin figurines, $3 attractive margarita candles, floating rose candles, AZ t-shirts starting at 2/$10, and other nice items. Definitely better than many of the mall and airport souvenir shops encountered on this trip. Some of the hallways do stink. I thought it smelled like a bathroom not really clean lurking behind a door--okay, I'll say it--old urine. I am more sensitive to smells than others--many of my companions noticed nothing, but a few others thought it smelled, too. Some of the hallways show a lot of beating--big bangs out of the corners in many spots, jagged uneven ceiling cracks running the length of some hallways near one wall, a huge wooden armchair with nice upholstery but badly nicked wood sitting out of place outside the elevator, a new threshold cut and ready to install leaning against the wall, a smoke detector and trim pieces left outside a room door, plaster or some other building material marks in the carpet outside many room doors, and so on. It definitely shows evidence of serious renovations in progress, but undertaken long after needed. The hallways proved a little toasty, but the guest rooms and public rooms all remained pleasant. The room itself smelled clean and appeared clean, other than another one of those cream colored upholstered chairs identical to the two dirty ones in the lobby making its appearance in the corner of the room like a fungus growing up in a flower garden. It took a few tries to find a working light, though. Flipping the switch in the hall just inside the door produced no light. Turning on one of the lamps above the nightstands produced no light. Only after walking to the other end of the room and trying the floor lamp did a working light turn up. Good thing the hall remains well lit and that the curtains remain open to let in some of the nighttime lighting, or you might bump into several things trying to ever find a light when you first check in to your room. The comfortable king-size bed faces the large window, but remains out of view from the hall door, something I appreciate. The desk near the window has ample lighting and space to work. Two compact elegant wood nightstands flank the headboard. The sconce lamps above each nightstand beam with nice clean white fabric shades, well, that is once you call the front desk and get lightbulbs for the lamps. During the renovation, someone took them out of the lamps or never put them in there in the first place. The lady from the front desk came up herself with the bulbs promptly, put them in, and apologized. She conducted herself in a professional but friendly manner. The bathroom floor shines with great looking new marble tile. When you open the closet, however, you see bare concrete with old dried mastic compound--no tiles or covering at all. Renovation looking good here, but obviously not finished yet in this room. The strange angled low tub (or extra deep shower basin?) in a square unit looks older--the porcelain not so glossy any more, but clean. No black stuff appeared during showers as other folks reported from their stays. Water pressure and temperature ranked as good, and the toilet flushed well. The safety latch that you flip over to keep folks from entering from the hall showed signs of hasty or at least uncoordinated replacement. The flip over portion mounted on the frame hit the door about two inches above the ball portion mounted on the door, rendering it utterly useless. A renovation of this size will obviously require a lot of follow up on issues like this one. An ice run took longer than anticipated. A taped handwritten note on the fourth floor ice machine informed you it was out of order. The third floor proved interesting--obviously under serious renovation here. Buckets in the hall, plastic Big Gulp cups from workmen, the smell of adhesive compounds in the air, and an ice machine that was also out of order, but not marked. The second floor ice machine was working well and obviously new. A group dinner at the hotel for a conference turned out a mixed bag, but by far positive. The main course consisted of a fresh, tasty grilled chicken salad served in a fried tortilla bowl. The German chocolate cake for dessert, however, while it tasted okay, contained no coconut, substituted peanuts for the pecans, and other deviations--not at all what most would consider German chocolate cake. The main dish salad proved more than ample to satiate your appetite, so you didn't really need the cake anyway. In summary, would I stay here again? Yes. The staff proved excellent. The hotel facility itself was let go too long, but they are pouring a lot of money and effort into refurbishment to bring it back. I think it will be a comlpete jewel again given a few months more renovation. The rooms are clean and quiet at a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others. If I hadn't been locked into the reservation I would've gone to the other hotels in the area. The only good thing I heard was that staff from corporate was there looking to remodel the place. I hope they do. The biggest concern I had was that during the night and early mornings our shower would back up with black stuff. It really concerned me when I heard the same complaint from others staying there but nothing was ever done by the staff there. The good note that the staff was pleasant and nice considering what they had to deal with. But be warned, find someplace else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Yikes! Try to stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: This place is a sorry excuse for a Four Points by Sheraton. It is run-down, really showing its age, and seems like a hotel that would only be popular with the high school prom night crowd or the one-night-in-Phoenix-tourbus group. Our room was dirty, dark, and dated. The tile in the bathroom was dirty, the upholstered chairs in the living area were too scary to sit on, the bed linens were too thin, and the bed was extremely lumpy. Ugh! Even the mere memories of thiis room send shivers up my spine. One of the worst I've ever stayed in. We did try to "enjoy" the hotel's free continental breakfast that they provided (not sure if this is free for all guests or if it was part of my Starwood Preferred Gold status). At any rate, we would have done well to avoid it entirely. We both got violently ill after eating here and it took a whole day out of our vacation in Sedona to recover. There are plenty of fine hotels in Phoenix ... and even the Metrocenter area. Try those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and ratty”
Reviews.Author: mpugs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The staff was very nice, but the hotel was falling apart. The carpet was threadbare, the shower was not working very well, and the palce smelled. To make things worse, even the amenities were bad: the hottub was not working while I was there and the exercize room was falling apart. The treadmill has to be about 20 years old, and even the vinyl on the weight set was cracking. I asked them to move me to an upgraded "business room" after two nights, but that was exactly the same! The only difference was free internet access. I told the staff how run down the room was and they obviously had heard it many times before - they just apologized. This place is close to another new Sheraton that would be much better if you need to be in this part of Phoenix. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the proximity to the Metocenter Mall, but the mall has seen better days too. . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Four Points was great hotel for the price. Great courtyard with a clean impressive pool area. The staff was the best I have ever encountered, and all employees said "hello" or "How is everything". I do not think you would experience a hotel staff this great unless your dropped over $200. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “shabby and run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Threadbare carpeting, dingy walls (stained paint and tattered wall paper), dilapadated furniture (cigarette burned ragged arm chair, broken-down armoire etc.), these rooms did not come close to what I expected from a Four-points Sheraton accomadation.

HotelInfo.Name: InnPlace Hotel Phoenix North
HotelInfo.Address: 10220 N. Metro Pkwy E., Phoenix, AZ 85051 (Formerly Four Points by Sheraton Phoenix North)
